newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU industrial confidence continues upward trend.
newsitem.headline: EU industrial confidence continues upward trend.

text.p: Confidence among European Union industrial firms continued to improve in March, with a majority expecting selling prices of goods to rise in the coming months, the European Commission said on Tuesday.
In its monthly review of economic sentiment among consumers, businesses and construction firms, the Commission found that "all industrial indicators continued to progress favourably."
"There is now for the first time since December 1995, a majority of European manufacturing managers who expect selling prices to augment in the coming months," the Commission said.
Overall, the EU's sentiment index, which combines the level of confidence across all sectors, rose to 101.3 in March from 101.1 in the prior month. In 1996 the index averaged 98.9.
Virtually all of the EU's 15 members posted a rise in the sentiment index. Belgium and France were the only countries showing a deterioration.
In France, a slight worsening in consumer expectations pulled down the total index.
Germany, meanwhile, showed a noticeable improvement in all three categories, with the sentiment index rising to 99.1 from 98.6.
The survey also found that pessimism in the construction industry has diminished, with the confidence indicator rising to its highest level since November 1995.
